text: @Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 For my sins 🤣🤣 about 15 years now. Thinking of moving back. Hard to stomach the Tory government, but fear the mess Labour will be left with. Off to bed now. Nice talking 🙂
@Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 I'm not sure how I would vote if I was back home in Scotland (definitely not Tory though!). It would take a while to cut through the rhetoric.

@Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 Personally I'd prefer to see politicians work together to reach decent, sensible decisions for us. Whether that means the UK stays intact or not, I'm not sure about, but first priority should be to find a solution to the current crisis.
@Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 I imagine that's due to being the party fighting against the status quo of UK unity. I felt the same about pro Brexit voters. Probably just our perception.
@Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 True, but which other party could have formed a government?
@Elizabe46179288 @ziggy6769 I think it's fair to say the behaviour of people on social media can be embarrassing regardless of their political allegiance.
@2351onthelist @ziggy6769 I agree. Took votes for granted, I imagine.
@2351onthelist @ziggy6769 Certainly doesn't sound like a fair result.

@shazzabomb42 @RemainerPaul @jmarcjones @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 When in the EU the UK could potentially return asylum seekers to the first safe country. That is not possible now per the Refugee Convention long before Tony Blair.
@shazzabomb42 @RemainerPaul @jmarcjones @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 Now you've scraped the bottom of the barrel.

@shazzabomb42 @RemainerPaul @jmarcjones @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 The point is there is no possibility of an asylum seeker turning up at the airport in their country to fly to the UK. Also no obligation to apply in the first safe country, Brexit changed that.
@shazzabomb42 @RemainerPaul @jmarcjones @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 And sadly, you must have the visa to be allowed to travel, or the airline is penalised for accepting the passenger.
@shazzabomb42 @RemainerPaul @jmarcjones @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 Even Suella Braverman admitted there is no legal path.
@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 Now that's ridiculous.
@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 So let me get this straight, a call to prayer on a Friday in Stockton is being compared to Qatar's laws?

@BrutalDeluxe6 @dokta01 @JackieD86388657 Not at all, I believe in respecting all cultures and religions. The fact is the UK is multi cultural, a call to prayer is no different to a church's bell ringing.
@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 And being Christian should mean respecting all other religions.

@BrutalDeluxe6 @dokta01 @JackieD86388657 Simply because other countries organise differently is not a reason for the UK to match their limitations. At least not the inclusive UK I'd prefer to live in.
@Stevemfc3 @JackieD86388657 That's your prerogative.
@ziggy6769 Their new leader does seem to be down to earth, but I'm not sure if he is aligned with Starmer, which could be a problem either way (Brexit).
@ziggy6769 Strange though, when I lived in Scotland it was quite staunchly Labour, which seems to have disintegrated over the years.
@emilyhewertson Ugh!
@ziggy6769 Serious question. Would that work with the Scottish voting system? Seems quite complicated. Easy to do here in England's FPTP though, if there's an appetite for it.
@ziggy6769 I agree. The other parties clearly need to do more to encourage voters to change their allegiance, same as here in England.
@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 I agree. A call to prayer harms no one, and is the same as the Catholic church near my home ringing their bells every Sunday at 10am.

@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 Of course there's a difference between religion and culture. For me, respecting the Muslim religion could include a call to prayer for many people who respect our culture. Completly separate.
@ziggy6769 Then perhaps they need to reconsider how they vote. A vote for SNP is for independence. The people can fix this by not voting for them.
@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 Clearly you believe that respecting their religion is a problem. I disagree.

@ziggy6769 Even so, the SNP have been democratically elected as government for many years. The people decide and vote accordingly. The ballot box is where to effect change, but no party has successfully challenged.
@tomhfh Supporting Hancock is speaks volumes about your character. Describing his appalling decisions during the pandemic as 'competent' is bizarre to say the least.
@ziggy6769 Actually your comments do much to embarrass Scotland. Whether you like it or not, the SNP have gathered support over these years. Democracy.

@shazzabomb42 @JackieD86388657 @wardj15 I know I won't persuade you, but this is not true. My ex is Muslim, living in Cyprus now, but in the UK for many years. No plans at all to 'control and destroy'. Your viewpoint is frankly insulting to all Muslims.
